newsitem.title: USA: Petrolite's says strategic plan pays off.
newsitem.headline: Petrolite's says strategic plan pays off.

text.p: Petrolite Corp, which lost $6.8 million in the final quarter of 1995, said Thursday implementing a strategic overhaul helped drive earnings growth in its fiscal 1996 fourth quarter.
"This turnaround has been fueled by the initiatives we set in motion a year ago," said Paul Hatfield, Petrolite chairman, president and chief executive officer, in a statement.

Net income in the fourth quarter of fiscal 1996 totaled $6.1 million, compared with a $6.8-million loss one year ago, when it took a $9-million charge to write down assets. Fiscal 1996 fourth quarter revenues were $95.8 million, up five percent from 1995 results.
Results benefited from restructuring the management of the company's business units, implementing a new accounting system and overhauling internal business systems, Hatfield said.
Petrolite is a specialty chemical company that provides products for energy-related industrial companies.
